targets.expr:
sum(
  kube_pod_container_resource_requests{
    resource="cpu",
    app_name=~"$app_name",
    app_version=~"$app_version",
    region=~"$region",
    cluster_id=~"$cluster_id",
    env=~"$env"
  }
  and on(namespace, pod) max by (namespace, pod) (
    kube_pod_status_phase{
      phase="Running",
      app_name=~"$app_name",
      app_version=~"$app_version",
      region=~"$region",
      cluster_id=~"$cluster_id",
      env=~"$env"
    } == 1
  )
)
/
sum(
  kube_node_status_capacity{
    resource="cpu",
    app_name=~"$app_name",
    app_version=~"$app_version",
    region=~"$region",
    cluster_id=~"$cluster_id",
    env=~"$env"
  }
)

sum(
  kube_pod_container_resource_limits{
    resource="cpu",
    app_name=~"$app_name",
    app_version=~"$app_version",
    region=~"$region",
    cluster_id=~"$cluster_id",
    env=~"$env"
  }
  and on(namespace, pod) max by (namespace, pod) (
    kube_pod_status_phase{
      phase="Running",
      app_name=~"$app_name",
      app_version=~"$app_version",
      region=~"$region",
      cluster_id=~"$cluster_id",
      env=~"$env"
    } == 1
  )
)
/
sum(
  kube_node_status_capacity{
    resource="cpu",
    app_name=~"$app_name",
    app_version=~"$app_version",
    region=~"$region",
    cluster_id=~"$cluster_id",
    env=~"$env"
  }
)

sum(
  kube_pod_container_resource_requests{
    resource="memory",
    app_name=~"$app_name",
    app_version=~"$app_version",
    region=~"$region",
    cluster_id=~"$cluster_id",
    env=~"$env"
  }
  and on(namespace, pod) max by (namespace, pod) (
    kube_pod_status_phase{
      phase="Running",
      app_name=~"$app_name",
      app_version=~"$app_version",
      region=~"$region",
      cluster_id=~"$cluster_id",
      env=~"$env"
    } == 1
  )
)
/
sum(
  kube_node_status_capacity{
    resource="memory",
    app_name=~"$app_name",
    app_version=~"$app_version",
    region=~"$region",
    cluster_id=~"$cluster_id",
    env=~"$env"
  }
)

sum(
  kube_pod_container_resource_limits{
    resource="memory",
    app_name=~"$app_name",
    app_version=~"$app_version",
    region=~"$region",
    cluster_id=~"$cluster_id",
    env=~"$env"
  }
  and on(namespace, pod) max by (namespace, pod) (
    kube_pod_status_phase{
      phase="Running",
      app_name=~"$app_name",
      app_version=~"$app_version",
      region=~"$region",
      cluster_id=~"$cluster_id",
      env=~"$env"
    } == 1
  )
)
/
sum(
  kube_node_status_capacity{
    resource="memory",
    app_name=~"$app_name",
    app_version=~"$app_version",
    region=~"$region",
    cluster_id=~"$cluster_id",
    env=~"$env"
  }
)

sum(
  kube_pod_container_resource_requests{
    resource="cpu",
    app_name=~"$app_name",
    app_version=~"$app_version",
    region=~"$region",
    cluster_id=~"$cluster_id",
    env=~"$env"
  }
  and on(namespace, pod) max by (namespace, pod) (
    kube_pod_status_phase{
      phase="Running",
      app_name=~"$app_name",
      app_version=~"$app_version",
      region=~"$region",
      cluster_id=~"$cluster_id",
      cell_id=~"$cell_id",
      env=~"$env"
    } == 1
  )
)

sum(
  ${rate_func}(
    k8s_node_cpu_time_seconds_total{
      app_name=~"$app_name",
      app_version=~"$app_version",
      region=~"$region",
      cluster_id=~"$cluster_id",
      env=~"$env"
    }[$__rate_interval]
  )
) by (k8s_node_name)
/
sum(
  label_replace(
    kube_node_status_capacity{
      resource="cpu",
      app_name=~"$app_name",
      app_version=~"$app_version",
      region=~"$region",
      cluster_id=~"$cluster_id",
      env=~"$env"
    },
    "k8s_node_name",
    "$1",
    "node",
    "(.+)"
  )
) by (k8s_node_name)

list.description:
This variable controls the mathematical function used to calculate per-second rates across the dashboard.

    Overview (rate): Calculates the average rate over the entire time interval. Best for spotting trends, capacity planning, and long-term views.

    Debug (irate): Calculates the "instant" rate based on the last two data points. Best for high-resolution troubleshooting and catching micro-spikes.

 Warning: irate should only be used when zoomed in to < 1 hour. On longer time ranges (e.g., 7 days), irate ignores most data points between pixels and will provide a misleading representation of your traffic.
list.label: Mode
list.name: rate_func
